timeline.bodyText: Formatting looks non-standard in these file. Also, you're missing the copyright notices.
timeline.author: jkwatson

timeline.bodyText: This example is really an example of API usage, just using the SDK classes. I think these examples should focus on operator/application owner setup/configuration of the SDK, rather than repeating API usage examples.
timeline.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: isn't that covered by ConfigureSpanProcessorExample and ConfigureTraceExample?
replies.author: thisthat

timeline.author: arminru

timeline.bodyText: that would fit well into your DemoUtils class

timeline.bodyText:
That's likely to break when the SDK is developed further and wouldn't be discovered easily since the build wouldn't break.
Do you think it would make sense to (cleanly) expose the configured span processors on TracerSdkProvider?
timeline.author: arminru

replies.bodyText: I think this question should be addressed in an issue so everyone can contribute with their opinion.
replies.author: thisthat

timeline.bodyText: for examples, we should use the Logging exporter, since it will actually output visible information
timeline.author: jkwatson

timeline.message: Update build to depend on snapshots and apply gjf

timeline.bodyText: Mention it is printing custom information, for the sake of the example?
timeline.author: carlosalberto

timeline.bodyText: Mention this is a rather uncommon case?
timeline.author: carlosalberto

replies.bodyText: I will remove complete this case and move the explanatory comments into the custom SpanProcessor in ConfigureTraceExample.

timeline.bodyText: why not just tracerProvider.shutdown()
timeline.author: bogdandrutu

timeline.bodyText: TraceConfig config = tracerProvider.getActiveTraceConfig();
timeline.author: bogdandrutu

timeline.bodyText: TraceConfig newConf = tracerProvider.getActiveTraceConfig().toBuilder().setMaxNumberOfAttributes(1).build();
timeline.author: bogdandrutu

timeline.bodyText: Same comment, always start from the currentConfig to update one argument :)
timeline.author: bogdandrutu

timeline.bodyText: Just use the simplespanprocessor + loggingexporter?
timeline.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: I wanted to showcase the possibility to create your own span processor with this class. Furthermore, with this class the attributes are pretty printed while with the loggingexporter they would be embedded with other span information.
replies.author: thisthat

replies.bodyText: Then split it into one example to configure the SDK using TraceConfig + Views for metrics when they will be available. Second example to create your own SpanProcessor. I think most of the people are interested in the first example.
replies.author: bogdandrutu

timeline.bodyText:
I really like this example.
nit: Should this be public if you have a public main, sorry haven not written too many main functions in my life?
timeline.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: It is not required to execute the main, but the convention says this should be public since its the name of the file!
replies.author: thisthat

timeline.bodyText: Can we just remove this for the moment? Is it a big downgrade in experience?
timeline.author: bogdandrutu

+import io.opentelemetry.sdk.trace.MultiSpanProcessor;
+import io.opentelemetry.sdk.trace.SpanProcessor;
+import io.opentelemetry.sdk.trace.TracerSdk;
+import java.lang.reflect.Field;
+import java.lang.reflect.Method;
+import java.util.List;
+
+/**
+ * These methods use reflection to access private fields of the tracer. This is meant as
+ * demonstration only. It is SEVERELY discouraged to access private fields since they are shared
+ * among different threads.
+ */
+@SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
+public class DemoUtils {

replies.bodyText:
I know this is a hacky way of doing things that will hardly scale with further changes. Unfortunately, I don't have another solution for showing to the end user of the ConfigureSpanProcessorExample example which SpanProcessor is initialized.
Would you suggest to remove the console output for that example along with the DemoUtils class?
replies.author: thisthat

replies.bodyText: Let's add a DebugString() or ToString() method on the provider SDK that prints this information for debugging purposes :). What do you think?
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: It sounds a very good solution!
replies.author: thisthat

replies.bodyText: After a tiny bit of investigation, this requires to add such a method in all SpanProcessor implementation. I will simply add a comment that tells the reader which SpanProcessor is registered.
replies.author: thisthat

replies.bodyText: So personally I don't mind having this util class here - I suggest following this up in a PR/issue if you really want it out @bogdandrutu ;)
replies.author: carlosalberto

replies.bodyText: @thisthat you mentioned that you removed this?
